title: About me!
text:
About me!

  
    Academic
  
  
    Personal
  


  
    I am an incoming PhD student in the Department of Psychology at Emory University in the Cognitive and Computational Sciences area.

    My work takes a neuroscientific approach to investigating memory, perception and learning in minds, brains and machines. I work extensively with (f)MRI and actively contribute to and develop novel tools for analysis of neuroimaging data.

    Prior to joining Emory, I completed my undergraduate degree in Psychology at Louisiana State University (LSU) where I worked with Christopher Cox and Julie M. Schneider. While at LSU, I studied learning and language in adults and kids and evaluated signal processing operations for developmental EEG data.
  
  
    I thoroughly enjoy The Simpsons. I have a favorite episode which I watch regurlarly (S8E23; Homer's Enemy).

    In my free time, I play the violin (which I have been doing for 10+ years) and code. I am an avid programmer and have found great utility in this skill (e.g., better logical abilities).

    I also really like food and will eat practically anything. Not a big fan of raisins though. 
  




Pictures

text:
How to contact me

title: Will Decker
text:
I am an incoming PhD student in the Department of Psychology at Emory University in the Cognitive and Computational Sciences area.
My work takes a neuroscientific approach to investigating memory, perception and learning in minds, brains and machines. I work extensively with (f)MRI and actively contribute to and develop novel tools for analysis of neuroimaging data.
Prior to joining Emory, I completed my undergraduate degree in Psychology at Louisiana State University (LSU) where I worked with Christopher Cox and Julie M. Schneider. While at LSU, I studied learning and language in adults and kids and evaluated signal processing operations for developmental EEG data.

title: Will Decker
text:
I am an incoming PhD student in the Department of Psychology at Emory University on the Cognitive and Computational (Neuro) Sciences track.
My work takes a neuroscientific approach to investigate memory, perception and learning in minds, brains and machines. I work extensively with (f)MRI and actively work to contribute to and develop novel tools for (f)MRI anal
I primarily work with Ali Cohen but also collaborate with Daniel Dilks as well as Anna Ivanova at Georgia Tech.

title: Will Decker
text:
I am an incoming PhD student in the Department of Psychology at Emory University on the Cognitive and Computational (Neuro) Sciences track.
I study memory, perception and learning in minds, brains and machines.
I primarily work with Ali Cohen but also collaborate with Daniel Dilks as well as Anna Ivanova at Georgia Tech.
Prior to joining Emory, I completed my undergraduate degree in Psychology at Louisiana State University (LSU) where I worked with Christopher Cox and Julie M. Schneider. While at LSU, I studied learning and language in adults

title: Learning and Resources
text:
Learning and Resources
I have always felt that teaching a concept significantly increases one’s own understanding of that concept. I have tried to create cursory reviews of a few topics relevent to cognitive and computational neuroscience. These topics range from mathematical concepts, to coding and more.
I have also created some resources that have streamlined my research, including \(\LaTeX\) templates and custom coding modules. I’ve made them open-source for a reason!

  Plot ROIs
